choices.B: The port1 default route has a higher priority value than the default route using port2.
choices.D: The port1 default route has a lower distance than the default route using port2.
choices.A: The port2 interface is disabled in the FortiGate configuration.
choices.C: The port1 default route has a lower priority value than the default route using port2.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
first command displays the routing table database, showing all routes that the FortiGate has learned, including both active and inactive routes.
second command displays the active routing table, showing only the routes that are currently being used by the FortiGate to forward traffic.
port2 route has a distance of 20, while the port1 route has a distance of 10; prefers the route with the lower distance, so the port1 default route is chosen and installed in the active routing table

correct answer: D

Selected Answer: D
State TIME WAIT is for out-of-order-packets arriving too late

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, NONE state does not account for a handshake attempt that would be SYN SENT, TIME WAIT means the FW is waiting for any out of order packets before closing the session.

Selected Answer: D
Correct is D, out-of-order packets in state TIME_WAIT (5)

choices.C: There are 166 TCP sessions waiting to complete the three-way handshake.

choices.A: All the sessions in the session table are TCP sessions.
choices.D: There are two sessions that have not been removed in case of any out-of- order packets that arrive.

AD is correct, the LDAP bind was arelady completed and in this output it is searching for the user.

Selected Answer: CD
my answer is CD.
fortiGate will not advertise a BGP network unless it has a matching route in its local routing table. 
in this case, FGT-Bâ€™s interface is in the 172.16.54.0/24 subnet, but the BGP configuration is set to 172.16.0.0/16. 
to fix this, you can either modify the prefix to 172.16.54.0/24 (Answer C), or disable the network-import-check (Answer D) so that FortiGate will advertise the network even without an exact route match.

choices.C: Modify the prefix using the network command from 172.16.0.0/16 to 172.16.54.0/24.
choices.B: Manually add the BGP route on FGT-A.
choices.A: Restart BGP using a soft reset, which forces both peers to exchange their complete BGP routing tables.
choices.D: Use the set network-import-check disable command.

choices.A: The local router initiated the BGP session to 10.200.3.1 but did not receive a response.
choices.D: The local router has a different AS number than the remote peer.
choices.C: The router 10.200.3.1 has authentication configured for BGP and the local router does not.
choices.B: The local router is receiving BGP keepalives from the remote peer, but the local peer has not received the OpenConfirm yet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
